definition: lit. sth hits one in the face/directly in one's face/sth assaults the senses/blatant (advertising)/eye-catching/(a smell) assaults the nostrils
to throw oneself at/to pounce on/to devote one's energies/to flap/to flutter/to dab/to pat/to bend over
flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
variant of 麵|面[mian4]
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc
lit. sth hits one in the face/directly in one's face/sth assaults the senses/blatant (advertising)/eye-catching/(a smell) assaults the nostrils

sentences.english: In northern Siberia, bone-chilling winds sweep down from the Pole.
sentences.chinese: 在西伯利亚之北，来自极地的刺骨寒风扑面而吹。

sentences.english: Just enter the scenic area, will have a cool breeze blowing.
sentences.chinese: 刚迈入景区，便有阵阵凉风扑面。

sentences.english: The snow was blowing in his face, but the gritted his teeth and went on.
sentences.chinese: 大雪扑面，但是他咬紧牙关，继续前进。

sentences.english: The acrid smell of lamb kebabs and the sweet smell of cakes soaked in honey reign over everything else.
sentences.chinese: 烤羊肉串的辛香和蜜制蛋糕的甜香扑面而来。

sentences.english: Early in the morning when the sliding window, there is the smell of rain, but the thick autumn is coming.
sentences.chinese: 晨起推窗，还有雨的气息，但那浓浓的秋凉扑面而来。

sentences.english: The Resting Area for Guests are redecorated in a festival atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 来宾休息区装点一新，扑面而来的喜悦氛围。

sentences.english: Give an air kiss to the person on your opposite.
sentences.chinese: 给坐在扑面的人一个飞吻。

sentences.english: With wafts of the science book kissing me I bought it without hesitation.
sentences.chinese: 这本科技书书香扑面，我毫不犹豫地买下来了。

sentences.english: Our society is developing rapidly, economy based knowledge and society of information is coming.
sentences.chinese: 人类社会迅猛发展，知识经济和信息化社会扑面而来。

sentences.english: Open the lid, an intense gasoline blowing.
sentences.chinese: 打开壶盖，一股浓烈的汽油味扑面而来。

sentences.english: Opened the window, rushing toward us is a light rain started falling day.
sentences.chinese: 推开窗，扑面而来的是一个细雨霏霏的日子。

sentences.english: As soon as I walked outside, I was greeted with white shimmering blanket of cold.
sentences.chinese: 刚出门，扑面而来的是一片晶莹雪白的冰冷。

sentences.english: I was greeted with the shimmering white blanket of cold.
sentences.chinese: 扑面而来的是一大片晶莹雪白的冰凉。

sentences.english: The acrid smell of lamb kebabs and the sweet smell of cakes soggy in honey predominate over everything else.
sentences.chinese: 烤羊肉串的辛香和蜜制蛋糕的甜香扑面而来。

sentences.english: The rain was driving in his face.
A sense of satire is strongly felt.
sentences.chinese: 强烈的讽刺味道扑面而来。

definition: lit. sth hits one in the face/directly in one's face/sth assaults the senses/blatant (advertising)/eye-catching/(a smell) assaults the nostrils
directly/head-on (collision)/in one's face (of wind)
strong wind/gale
heat wave
biting cold
directly/head-on (collision)/in one's face (of wind)
to whistle/to scream/to whiz
to assail the nostrils (of fragrance and odors)
(of a perfume or a foul odor) permeating the whole place/(of grease etc) dripping everywhere/flowing all over the place
sound of the wind blowing or rain falling
gale/squall/whole gale (meteorology)
vast haze/lost in boundless mists
to pervade/to fill the air/diffuse/everywhere present/about to inundate (water)/permeated by (smoke)/filled with (dust)/to saturate (the air with fog, smoke etc)
variant of 彌漫|弥漫[mi2 man4]
lit. to fill the whole sky/everywhere/as far as the eye can see
to feel suddenly/to realize abruptly
soughing (of the wind)
